page.title: 05THE BUTCHER AT DIGSWELL
page.content: In the main street of Digswell village Mr Marsh has a posh, old fashioned butchers shop. He has run it since 1961 with his wife. He has an antique cash till and a collection of old clevers and scales. The meat is supplied from Norfolk. Chicken and beef are most popular, but he also sells unusual meats like venison. Fillet steak is his his most expensive meat. Christmas is the busiest time of year and Friday (3.30 - 4.30) and Saturday are the busiest days. He is closed on Sunday, Monday and Saturday afternoon. He takes Â£2,000 per week. He has had 2 burglaries when both meat and money were stolen. He is happy to continue being a butcher here in Digswell until he retires. {KEVIN CUNNINGHAM (11) {
